TopicTitle: Fanwork Friday: A look behind the scenes

Articles.Content: Bob Fitch is one of those YouTubers that are often featured on our social media, and for good reason. His Odyssey and Alexandria KSP series are certainly of a very high quality. Those of you who follow him will have certainly seen the interludes, which he uses to insert the story line into the Project Odyssey videos. Now Bob gives us a behind the scenes look at how these videos come together, a great video for his followers, but also for people who wonder how video editing works.

The project Alexandria is so well and meticulously made. Bob uses real life models of probes for each of his historic launches. And the videos from historic archives about rocket building and mass media covering the events really make you relive the launches again.

Bravo Bob!
Love bob's videos. Haven't got round to watching alexandria yet though.

I'm so glad you highlighted this, as I hadn;t heard of Bob Fitch before - so I've now another few series of KSP adventures to look forward to, having caught up on those of Scott Manley. Have just watched episode 1 of Project Gatewyay. Excellent. Thank you!

>

Enjoy! They're really well made video's and very enjoyable to watch.

Sooo glad to see a video in Fanwork Fridays, because Wednesday and Thursday just aren't enough for videos when you all spend so much time also highlighting ... erm, mods on Monday.

I realise you think your market consists entirely of the TV generation but some of us can read too! Given the comparatively huge broadband cost of videos like this PLEASE can't you at least nod in the direction of something else?
That video editor looks familiar. I should watch this just to see how he uses it. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
